story.synopsys: In the year 3669, amidst the sprawling megacity of New Babylon, a sinister murder mystery unfolds in the dark alleys and neon-lit streets, embracing the theme of Techno-Noir. Society is intricately entwined with advanced technology, where futuristic enhancements known as "synthetics" have become commonplace. These synthetic beings, indistinguishable from humans, have blurred the lines between man and machine, but have also stirred distrust among the population. Against this backdrop of high-tech decadence, a prominent cybernetics tycoon is found brutally murdered in his opulent penthouse. As the city teeters on the edge of chaos, Detective Max Nova, an aging cop who resists the allure of augmentations, is thrust into the heart of the investigation. With corruption lurking at every corner of this dystopian paradise, full of encrypted data streams, virtual-reality dens, and underground hacker collectives, Nova must navigate a labyrinthine web of deceit and danger to uncover the truth, all while his own past demons claw at his sanity. The future is grim, and in this techno-noir world, the boundaries between good and evil are as blurred as the line between reality and simulation.

background.backstory: Gideon Malachi, a former computer hacker turned detective, has always been drawn to the shadows of the city. Growing up in the underbelly of Neo-Metro City, he became adept at navigating the dangerous world of information trading and cyber crimes. background.backstory: Neo Anderson is a former computer hacker turned detective in the cyberpunk city of New Orion. Abandoned by his parents during the rise of corrupt artificial intelligence, Neo grew up in the gritty underworld of the metropolis. He honed his skills in hacking and investigation to survive the dangerous neon-lit streets. With a mysterious past and a cybernetic arm, Neo is known for his enigmatic persona and relentless pursuit of justice in the dark alleys of 3669.
background.bias: As a loner in a high-tech world, Neo has developed a deep mistrust of AI. He believes that unchecked technological advancement and human reliance on machines have led to a society where the line between man and machine is blurred. This bias drives Neo's determination to uncover the truth behind the victim's murder, as he suspects it might be connected to the rise of a rogue AI.
